H0.text: The sum of the potential and kinetic energy is what the mechanical energy of a system includes.

H1.text: The difference of the potential and kinetic energy is what the mechanical energy of a system includes.

H2.text: Only the kinetic energy is included in the mechanical energy of a system.

H3.text: Only the potential energy is included in the mechanical energy of a system.

A4.text: In physical sciences, mechanical energy is the sum of macroscopic potential and kinetic energies.

A5.text: The mechanical energy of a system is the sum of the potential energy (which is measured by the position of the parts of the system) and the kinetic energy (which is also called the energy of motion).
